item.description: This is my first time using Mac OS for productivity and here’s what I discovered switching from Windows to Mac OS on a Macbook Air M1.

item.title: What is the AIDA model in marketing?
item.description: The AIDA model is a widely-used marketing and advertising framework that stands for Attention, Interest, Desire, and Action, and has been used to create effective content.

item.title: Reimagining the Marketing Funnel with the Discovery Stage
item.description: By introducing the Discovery stage, we can help our potential prospects discover a problem exists, create impactful first impressions, generate that initial interest, and expand our reach to individuals who may not have been actively seeking our products or services.

item.title: What is the JAMStack and Why Should Digital Marketers Care
item.description: The JAMStack is a modern architecture for building websites and web apps and offers several benefits like including faster page load times, improved security, and better search engine optimization (SEO). Read why you should care.

item.title: Maximizing Email Marketing RoI
item.description: Not all email marketing campaigns are created equal, and without a focused approach, you may not see the return on investment (ROI) you’re aiming for.

item.title: 9 Things No One Can Teach You In Your Digital Marketing Career
item.description: If youâ€™re just getting started in Digital Marketing, there are certain factors that can make or break your performance. Things that can aid you in avoiding typical problems and errors, and then there are things that can give you a competitive advantage.

item.title: About Digital Side Quest
item.description: Welcome to the Digital Side Quest ðŸ•¹! I started this blog as a personal journaling project to document my digital life including my experiences with hardware and software, how I setup something or fixed a problem, and basically everything concerning my interactions with the digital world. I’ve been a digital marketer for over a decade now, and I enjoy reading, writing and playing video games.
